summary: A client hired me to create a website from mock-up images. I created HTML and
CSS from these images using Foundation.
Then, with a friend, we created the site using Ruby on Rails and deployed it to Amazon EC2 running NGINX, Passenger and PostgreSQL.
We used Git for source control and Trello for issue tracking. I set up a Google Apps account for email.
Worked remotely on a team with [Google Web Toolkit](https://developers.google.com/web-toolkit/),
[Eclipse](http://www.eclipse.org/), [MySQL](http://www.mysql.com/) on large code base with many
custom components. Used [CVS](http://www.nongnu.org/cvs/) for source control and [Trac](http://trac.edgewall.org/) for
Initially tasked with implementing a monthly report to be delivered to 9,000 Cru staff, integration
issues arose in the analytics platform that was going to deliver the report. A co-worker and I designed a new platform
using the Javascript Client-Side View paradigm. The new version of the report uses Java (JAX-RS, JBoss App Server) on
the server, fetching data from an Oracle Answers (BI Analytics tool) via SOAP. I wrote most of the JavaScript and
worked with a designer on the HTML and CSS. To get started, I used Bootstrap and HTML5 Boilerplate, the Angular.js
framework to manage communication with the server via REST and the D3.js library to generate SVG charts. GitHub and
Wrote tool in Java to communicate with Oracle Answers and verify summarized tables against detail tables.
Used Actors and Futures to achieve high concurrency and high throughput.
Read Google API documentation and extended existing Java system to update a user's
[Google Apps for Business](http://www.google.com/intl/en/enterprise/apps/business/) password when their Single Sign-On
[(JASIG CAS)](http://www.jasig.org/cas) password is changed including an exponential backoff algorithm to prevent Denial of Service.
Converted two Java applications that were previously built using [Eclipse](http://www.eclipse.org/) to
[Maven](http://maven.apache.org/) and setup to be deployed with a single click using
Competed against friends and strangers online, [Common Lisp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Lisp). [Contest Homepage](http://planetwars.aichallenge.org/)
With a partner, wrote the only multi-player game in class.
The client was written in C and used [SDL](http://www.libsdl.org/) for keyboard controls and
[OpenGL](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenGL) for graphics. The server was written in
[Common Lisp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Lisp). The client and server were designed to run on Linux.
A group project in Operating Systems class. The server was written in [Common Lisp](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Lisp).
The client was written in C, using [ncurses](http://www.gnu.org/software/ncurses/) for the GUI and
[Embeddable Common Lisp](http://ecls.sourceforge.net/) for the application logic and networking. The client was
designed to run on the Linux command line. I was responsible for coordinating the GUI and ECL. We used
Written in [PHP](http://php.net/) and used a [MySQL](http://www.mysql.com/) database, this was my first site that
other people depended on. Used at a 5000+ attendee conference in 2005, 2007, 2009 and 2011 for reserving rooms and
[PHP](http://php.net/) based time tracker with a [MySQL](http://www.mysql.com/) database. Total length
was around 50 lines. I wrote it for a group project in school that I was leading.
Studied for Statistics II class by writing a statistics package.
Used [Selenium](http://seleniumhq.org/) to test Java web application that I inherited maintenance of.
Created my own keyboard shortcuts for tedious tasks in environments that did not have keyboard shortcuts and gave a presentation at Cru on it.
Wrote ecosystem simulation for parallel programming class, designed to run on 64 node
[OpenMPI](http://www.open-mpi.org/) library for parallelization. For extra credit in the class, I created a
visualization of the ecosystem over time by processing the output of the C program with a
CLI [PHP](http://php.net/) script which produced PNG images using the [GD Library](http://www.boutell.com/gd/).
I then used [MPlayer](http://www.mplayerhq.hu/design7/news.html) to turn the PNGs into a video.
